meanings.definition: To draw back or recoil in fear or surprise.
meanings.sent1: She blenched when she saw the spider crawling towards her.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise made him blench in shock.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected jump scare caused her to blench and spill her drink.
meanings.sent4: His heart blenched with terror as the ghostly figure appeared before him.
meanings.sent5: The sudden gust of wind made the leaves blench in fear.

meanings.sent1: He blenched before taking the plunge into the cold water.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't help but blench at the thought of speaking in front of a large audience.
meanings.sent3: The cat blenched before pouncing on the toy mouse.
meanings.sent4: His confidence blenched momentarily before he regained his composure.
meanings.sent5: The child blenched before trying the unfamiliar food.

meanings.definition: To turn pale or grow pale.
meanings.sent1: Her face blenched when she heard the bad news.
meanings.sent2: The patient's face blenched as the doctor delivered the diagnosis.
meanings.sent3: The joke was so funny that it made him blench with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The moonlight made the room blench with an eerie glow.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds caused the sky to blench with an ominous hue.
